title: The 12 Best Pore Minimizers for the Smoothest Skin
description: From degunking toners to facials in a jar.

What causes enlarged pores? “Pores are openings in the skin that are connected to sebaceous glands (oil producing glands) and hair follicles,” says Dr. Lal. “They play a major role in helping things get in and out of your skin. Depending on how oily your skin is, you may have more prominent pores than others.” Depending on your skin type, your pores may appear enlarged. “Pores are larger in people who make more skin oils,” says Dr. Lal. “Men tend to have larger pores than women. The central face, including the nose, often has more prominent pores. Congestion from skin products, pollutants, and excess oil all make pores appear bigger.” Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowIs it possible to shrink your pores?“While you can’t completely shrink pores, you can minimize the appearance of your pores,” explains Dr. Sobel. “Over time, pores can be reduced in size,” adds Dr. Lal.How can you minimize the appearance of pores?In addition to choosing products with effective cleansing, exfoliating, and tightening properties, it’s also key to consistently remove any makeup. “Removing makeup at the end of the day before washing your face is essential for preventing your pores from being clogged with oils and dirt,” says Dr. Lal. “Gentle exfoliation will help remove excess oil from your pores as well. You must be consistent with your skincare.”And remember, just as important as looking for ingredients that help improve the appearance of pores is avoiding products that can clog them. “It’s always crucial to look for products and makeup labeled non-comedogenic,” cautions Dr. Garshick.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowHow often should I use pore-minimizing products?“In general, the higher the concentration of the ingredient, the stronger the product may be, and therefore it may not be recommended to use as frequently,” Dr. Garshick says. “It is better to find a product that you can tolerate consistently than to use one that is very strong, but leaves the skin irritated and dry.”Why Trust ELLE BeautyAs a leading publisher of fashion, lifestyle, and beauty content, ELLE.com is committed to highlighting the best products in various categories by personally testing the latest and most innovative products, interviewing countless experts, and vetting customer-loved items. Before joining the team, she was an editor at Food Network Magazine and HGTV Magazine and ran the beauty section at The Pioneer Woman. Carol received her bachelor’s degree in Journalism from New York University and was one of the first customers to visit Glossier’s flagship store in New York’s Soho neighborhood. Over the years, she’s tested countless makeup, hair, and skin care products, and written hundreds of articles covering the beauty space, from pieces about the trendiest launches to roundups of the best products on the market. As a Korean-American, she grew up in a sea of Korean makeup and skin care products and is a bona fide expert on the ever-expanding world of K-beauty, helping lead our coverage. Additionally, she’s also always on the hunt for the perfect lipstick and watches the same few comfort sitcoms (Frasier, Cheers, Seinfeld, New Girl, etc.) over and over again.

Best Budget

Kate Somerville Mini ExfoliKate Intensive Pore Exfoliating Treatment

Pros
  • The dual-action formula smoothes and polishes skin
Cons
  • Can cause skin to tingle temporarily

Kate Somerville’s exfoliating treatment is a miracle in a bottle, as it works to minimize pores instantly. For best results, massage this treatment into your face for 30 seconds and leave it on for around two minutes before rinsing. You’ll likely notice results just after one use!

Key Ingredients: Papaya enzymes, lactic acid, aloe vera

Size: 0.5 fl. oz

Skin Type: All

Sephora rating: 4.3/5 stars

Our expert says: “I use the ExfoliKate Intensive Pore Exfoliating Treatment twice a week, and it’s a must-have staple in my skincare routine. Whenever I’m dealing with clogged pores, I like to use this product for a quick fix. I’ll apply it in the evening, and by the time I wake up in the morning, my skin looks drastically better.”—Lauren Tappan, beauty writer

Best Overall

Paula’s Choice Skin Perfecting 2% BHA Liquid

Pros
  • Gentle for sensitive skin
Cons
  • Can feel greasy on skin

When shopping for the best pore minimizers, Dr. Garshick says to “look for ones that include exfoliating acids, especially beta-hydroxy acids like salicylic acid, which is oil-soluble to help penetrate deep into pores and eliminate dead skin cells.” Featuring a potent two percent dose of salicylic acid, Paula’s Choice’s top product worldwide “removes buildup and helps reveal skin that is smoother and brighter, while also helping to address breakouts and improve the appearance of pores,” Garshick says. Essentially, this is your miracle in a bottle if you’re looking for a more even skin tone with added vibrancy. Just make sure you commit to it. A number of people report minimal results at first, but you should see a major difference with time.

Key Ingredients: Salicylic acid (BHA), green tea

Size: 4 fl. oz

Skin Type: All

Amazon rating: 4.5/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “This is an acid toner for those who are afraid of it. You might get a slight tingle from this, you may also not. However, you’ll definitely see and feel, with repeat use, smoother and less bumpy skin (it’s a great way to ward off impending breakouts). This formula contains a nice bit of salicylic acid to gently slough off dead skin and de-gunk pores so that they look cleaner, brighter, and smaller.” — Kathleen Hou, ELLE beauty director

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Best for Smooth Skin

U Beauty Resurfacing Compound

Cons
  • Contains benzyl alcohol, which might irritate sensitive skin

“The best long-term way to minimize pores is by using a topical retinoid that shrinks your sebaceous glands and thereby reduces pore size,” says Dr. Lal. According to Dr. Garshick, the ingredient also regulates cell turnover, which in turn can help boost collagen production to plump the skin and diminish fine lines. Created by blogger Tina Craig, this day-and-night retinol treatment should give you smoother, tighter skin after a single application. It also helps nourish via hyaluronic acid and reduce dark spots, thanks to vitamins C and E, making it the perfect multitasker in your routine.

Key Ingredients: Antioxidants, stabilized vitamin C, stabilized vitamin E, peptides, retinol, hyaluronic acid, AHAs

Size: 1 fl. oz

Skin Type: All

Amazon rating: 4.3/5 stars

An ELLE editor says: “I’ve used this product off and on for two years. Every time I don’t use it, my skin nose dives. I think to myself, ‘it’s just too expensive!’ So I switched to products that were cheaper, but not as powerful. I also had to buy all of the products that would encompass the Resurfacing compound. I basically spent the same amount by the time I was done with the cheaper vit. C, retinol, peptides, and hyaluraunic acid. Why deal with all of these bottle of sub-par product when I can spend the same amount for one product that does a better job?”

    Best Pore-Minimizing Mask

    Then I Met You Rosé Resurfacing Facial Mask

    Cons
    • May not be suited for sensitive skin

    Pores are no match for the AHAs and BHAs found in this viral mask, which works to lift dead skin cells and improve overall texture. Infused with real Damask Rose petals, it also helps strengthen and hydrate skin to banish fine lines and other signs of aging. For a refreshed feel, apply this mask to clean skin and leave it on for around 15 minutes.

    Key Ingredients: AHA/BHA rose complex, glycolic acid, lactic acid, salicylic acid, resveratrol, coptis japonica extract

    Size: 1.76 fl. oz

    Skin Type: All

    Amazon rating: 4/5 stars

    An ELLE editor says: “Resurfacing is a scary word, but this mask from Soko Glam founder Charlotte Cho is really not frightening at all. It contains soothing rose damask, resveratrol, and a healthy dose of glycolic and lactic acid, which you wash off after 10-15 minutes. My skin always feels so clean and soft after using this, and I love that I get a slight, but not frightening tingle, while it sits on my face.”—Kathleen Hou

      Pros

      • Great for oily skin

      Cons

This product is the band-aid of my makeup routine—it really fixes and sets everything.”—Danielle James, beauty expert

These pore strips are very easy to use, and you can easily leave them on overnight.

      SK-II Facial Treatment Essence

It also contains the brand’s proprietary nutrient-rich liquid, Pitera, which is designed to boost skin softness and smoothness.

Manyo’s version is non-comedogenic, making it suitable for everyone, no matter their skin type.

      Key Ingredients: Argan oil, sunflower seed oil, Spanish grape seed oil

              What causes enlarged pores?

              “Pores are openings in the skin that are connected to sebaceous glands (oil producing glands) and hair follicles,” says Dr. Lal. “They play a major role in helping things get in and out of your skin. Depending on how oily your skin is, you may have more prominent pores than others.” Depending on your skin type, your pores may appear enlarged. “Pores are larger in people who make more skin oils,” says Dr. Lal. “Men tend to have larger pores than women. The central face, including the nose, often has more prominent pores. Congestion from skin products, pollutants, and excess oil all make pores appear bigger.”

              Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

              Is it possible to shrink your pores?

              “While you can’t completely shrink pores, you can minimize the appearance of your pores,” explains Dr. Sobel. “Over time, pores can be reduced in size,” adds Dr. Lal.

              How can you minimize the appearance of pores?

              In addition to choosing products with effective cleansing, exfoliating, and tightening properties, it’s also key to consistently remove any makeup. “Removing makeup at the end of the day before washing your face is essential for preventing your pores from being clogged with oils and dirt,” says Dr. Lal. “Gentle exfoliation will help remove excess oil from your pores as well. You must be consistent with your skincare.”

              And remember, just as important as looking for ingredients that help improve the appearance of pores is avoiding products that can clog them. “It’s always crucial to look for products and makeup labeled non-comedogenic,” cautions Dr. Garshick.

              How often should I use pore-minimizing products?

              “In general, the higher the concentration of the ingredient, the stronger the product may be, and therefore it may not be recommended to use as frequently,” Dr. Garshick says. “It is better to find a product that you can tolerate consistently than to use one that is very strong, but leaves the skin irritated and dry.”
